info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 06 at 4:01PM EDT until May 06 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN BERTIE...SOUTHEASTERN NORTHAMPTON AND SOUTHWESTERN HERTFORD COUNTIES... At 401 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Roxobel, or near Aulander, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This severe storm will be near... Aulander and Woodland around 410 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Eagletown, Kelford, Earleys, George, Saint John, Potecasi, Menola, Millennium and Poor Town. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northeastern North Carolina. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
